title: Rallying the Tigers on to state
content: The Circleville Tigers got a huge send-off as they headed to Columbus’ Huntington Park on Friday to become the first baseball team in Pickaway County to play in the state tournament. Fans turned out at the school cheering the team on as the bus pulled away from the school. The team was led from the school and out of town by an escort made up of the Circleville Police Department and the Pickaway County Sheriff’s Office. Along the route, more supporters were out with signs and a large crowd turned out downtown wishing the team good luck as they passed by. For more on Circleville baseball, see B1.
